prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Practical Advice for Protecting Confidential Business Information

para.paratext: Some of the most sensitive confidential information, and that most frequently at issue in litigation, relates to the identification of customers, customer needs, purchasing history and contact persons. Any documents which demonstrate the employee's dealings with customers, intimate familiarity with the special needs of customers, or development of a personal relationship with customers should be maintained. Such records might include information demonstrating knowledge of customers' unique needs, rates charged, product history, etc. Also, any evidence which demonstrates that physical documents such as a customer list or directory have been removed from the former employer's premises will be critical in establishing a breach of the employer's confidential information.
